alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:22PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow and rain showers will affect northwestern Oxford... Coos...Sullivan...Grafton...Cheshire...western Hillsborough... northwestern Belknap...western Merrimack and northwestern Carroll Counties... At 1120 PM EDT...An area of heavy snow and rain showers was along a line extending from 14 miles north of Norton to near Heath Vermont...and moving northeast AT 35 MPH. The precipiation may initially start as rain but then temperatures will fall allowing most locations to turn to snow with slippery conditions possible. Locations impacted include... Keene, Claremont, Lebanon, Berlin, Franklin, Littleton, Jaffrey, Henniker, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Lincoln, New London, Plymouth, Meredith, Grafton, Hanover, Peterborough, Hopkinton and Charlestown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 14 and 60. Interstate 93 between mile markers 64 and 131. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, Franconia Notch, First Connecticut Lake, Kilkenny Ridge Trail, and Mount Moosilauke. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
